stimulusHtml: Respond to all parts of the question.

features.html:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

 

Tomburg and Perria are trading partners. Both countries have the same amount of resources and can produce butter and/or wheat. The production possibilities curves below show the combination of butter and wheat that each country can produce.

(a) Assume that prior to trade, Tomburg is producing 30 units of butter and 5 units of wheat. What can you conclude about the use of resources in Tomburg? Explain using the production possibilities curve model.

(b) Which country has the comparative advantage in the production of butter? Explain using numbers.

(c) Now assume each country specializes in the production of the good in which it has a comparative advantage, and the terms of trade are 4 units of butter for 1 unit of wheat. Are these terms of trade mutually beneficial? Explain.

(d) Assume Perria and Tomburg are able to increase their production of butter by 50%. Which country now has the absolute advantage in the production of butter? Explain using numbers.

(e) Assume Tomburg’s civilian working-age population is 5 million, the labor force participation rate in Tomburg is 80%, and the unemployment rate is 25%. Calculate the number of unemployed people in Tomburg. Show your work.
